intro: Pavonia hastata var. subconcolor, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features showy, tubular purple to pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, upright stems and heart-shaped, serrated leaves that are typically green with a slightly rough texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological biodiversity.
